case_vignette:
A 34-year-old female with past medical history of anxiety presents for evaluation of a 4 month history of abnormal nail grooves on the bilateral thumbnails. She denies any trauma that may have incited the nail changes. She does not get her nails done and does not wear nail polish. She admits to frequently rubbing her thumbnails with her index finger when she's nervous. Physical examination demonstrates longitudinal depressions on the bilateral midline thumbnails with horizontal ridges.  The patient is concerned that the nail changes may be a sign of an underlying systemic disease.  The patient is a non-smoker and does not drink alcohol.  The patient's mother has a history of anxiety and depression.  The patient's family history is otherwise unremarkable.  The patient is concerned that the nail changes may be a sign of an underlying systemic disease.  The patient is a non-smoker and does not drink alcohol.  The patient's mother has a history of anxiety and depression.  The patient's family history is otherwise unremarkable.

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have abnormal grooves on my bilateral thumbnails which have been there for about 4 months.
Have you experienced any changes in color or texture on your skin, nails, or both elsewhere?
No, the changes are only on my thumbnails.
Are you currently experiencing any other health issues or have you recently recovered from any illness?
No, I am not experiencing any other health issues nor have I recently recovered from any illness.
Are there any medications that you are currently taking or have taken in the past six months?
No, I am not currently taking any medications, nor have I taken any in the past six months.
Does anyone in your family have similar nail issues or any other skin-related diseases?
No, my family history is unremarkable for similar nail issues or other skin-related diseases.
Have you had any injury to your thumbs or hands recently?
No, I haven't had any injury to my thumbs or hands recently.
**Final Diagnosis:** Beau's lines
